content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Smelting Area (Position x=0.0 to x=4.0)
Consists of three furnaces:
- Furnace 1 (position x=0.0, y=0.0) - Copper plate production
- Furnace 2 (position x=2.0, y=0.0) - Copper plate production  
- Furnace 3 (position x=4.0, y=4.0) - Iron plate production

### Electronic Circuit Production Line (Position x=6.5 to x=12.5, y=11.5)
Consists of:
- Input chest (position x=6.5, y=11.5) storing iron plates and copper cables
- Burner inserter (position x=7.5, y=11.5) moving items from input chest to assembling machine
- Assembling machine (position x=9.5, y=11.5) crafting electronic circuits
- Burner inserter (position x=11.5, y=11.5) moving finished products to output chest
- Output chest (position x=12.5, y=11.5) storing iron plates, copper plates and electronic circuits

### Power Generation System (Position x=-9.5 to x=-2.5, y=22.5 to y=26.5)
Consists of:
- Offshore pump (position x=-9.5, y=24.5) 
- Pipe network carrying water (positions x=-9.5 to x=-7.5, y=22.5 to y=23.5)
- Boiler (position x=-7.0, y=24.5)
- Steam pipe network (position x=-5.5, y=24.5 to y=26.5)
- Steam engine (position x=-2.5, y=24.5)
- Electric pole network connecting power consumers

### Science Pack Input System (Position x=0.5, y=28.5 to y=31.5)
Consists of:
- Burner inserter (position x=0.5, y=30.5)
- Storage chest (position x=0.5, y=31.5) containing automation and logistic science packs

ERROR TIPS

### Inventory Management Errors
- Monitor inventory capacity before attempting to harvest resources
- When inventory is full, store excess materials in storage chests before continuing harvesting

### Resource Shortage Errors
- Ensure required input materials are available before attempting crafting operations
- The electronic circuit assembler requires both iron plates and copper cables to function properly

### Material Flow Issues
- Keep furnaces supplied with both ore and fuel to maintain continuous production
- Monitor and replenish coal levels in burner inserters and boilers regularly
